file_content.text: The commander... he should have been here by now....
It wouldn't have made a difference.
You'd still be dead.
This means he's safe... that's all that matters....
Your commander left you to die.
He abandoned you.
No, he's safe... all that matters is he's safe....
Please. Enough of this.
Commander, no! Run! Save yourself!
Just put him out of his misery, Sith.
He's suffered enough, I suppose.
Fine. [Kill Eligyn]
I think it would be so much more poignant if you pull the trigger.
You do it.
Commander...? What... what does this mean?
Goodbye, Captain.
Before I end his suffering, I want you to tell him the truth about you.
Confess to him.
Commander... what? I don't understand....
Your commander is an Imperial spy.
Rylon isn't who you think.
You lie! Please... it can't be.
Must you rub it in, Sith?
It gives me extreme pleasure, Rylon.
I must.
Nice of you to join us, Commander.
Welcome.
Would you like to rub it in?
Unless you want to.
Commander, no... tell me what the Sith says isn't true....
I'm sorry, Captain Eligyn. All these years, I have been a loyal soldier of the Empire.
No... I... can't believe....
It's unfortunate they were on the wrong side. They were excellent soldiers, and exceptional men.
They died like dogs.
Hardly.
It was difficult betraying them.
You can't bleed with a man and not form a bond. Yet, with their defeat, the Empire's cause is advanced.
I've never fought a tougher fight.
They gave me trouble.
This is a bittersweet day.
Why didn't you convert them to our cause?
You could have recruited them.
I follow Baras's orders to the letter. Recruitment was never my purpose here.
I served for the glory of the Empire. But the life of a spy is a slippery one.
In essence, I had to become a Republic soldier, and I've done things against the Empire that have sickened me.
At least your pain ends today.
I will relieve you.
But for the greater good, Commander.
It was necessary.
I have lived believing--hoping--that was the case, friend.
Today was inevitable. I knew Lord Baras would eventually have to eliminate me, but I'm proud to have been of service all this time.
Any last requests?
Prepare yourself.
If I may, there is one thing.
I'm honored to be the one to kill you.
I respect you.
You're just another drone. Easily replaced.
You will be forgotten.
That may be. But I hope you will grant me one last consideration. There is something I must know.
Now you die like a Republic soldier.
Then this is a fitting end.
Before I embrace my end, there is one thing I must know.
My son. He was the only thing in the world that was truly mine. And in love or weakness, I told him my secrets.
I... I know you had to cover my tracks, but please tell me, did he face his fate well?
His chin was held high, Commander.
He was brave.
Then I can die with a smile.
Better if I spare you the details.
You don't want to know.
I feared as much. Thank you for being delicate.
He whimpered like a craven coward.
He wet himself.
I see. You've crushed my spirit. Now, the death of my body is a formality.
When they find my corpse, there must be evidence of a valiant fight.
We must make this look convincing, Sith. So, I will not hold back. I will fight you as though you are my mortal enemy.
I'd have it no other way.
As it should be.
It will give me no pleasure to cut you down.
I won't enjoy this.
Our duty is often difficult, friend.
Maybe I'll break a sweat.
I'll try not to be bored.
Then arm yourself.
Tell Lord Baras it has been my great honor to serve him.
...the factory is under attack. Headquarters has been breached and casualties are severe.
Keep your wits, Captain. What do we know of the enemy?
Target is carving a bloody path in this direction. Unconfirmed reports suggest it's Sith.
Consider them confirmed.
It's true.
You're about to become part of the bloody path.
You're next.
First I'm going to kill your men, then you, Rylon.
Rylon!
Commander, contact confirmed. The enemy is Sith, repeat, the enemy is--
I can see that, Captain, shut up.
Sith, I know why you're here. Be aware that these are the finest troops I've commanded in all my decades of duty.
Consider me warned.
Good to know.
Am I supposed to turn tail and run now?
Should that scare me?
My men and I would be disappointed if you did.
I'll take pride in slaughtering them.
A good measuring stick for me.
Captain Eligyn, engage at will and hold the line. I'm coming with reinforcements. Rylon out.
You're about to find out what we're made of.
You're made of bones that break and blood that spills.
Mortal material, I suspect.
You don't intimidate us. We've killed your kind before.
You've never even seen my kind before.
You don't know me.
You're about to find out otherwise.
I may die of boredom.
Yawn.
We're not going to let boredom steal our kill.
Your commander will be too late.
Rylon isn't fast enough.
We've killed Sith before. I'm sure he'll understand if we've already left to celebrate.
At last, foes with a little backbone.
Worthy adversaries.
You'll find there's nothing little about us.
Enough talk, Captain. I can smell your fear.
Save the bravado.
Now taste death!
You're not very funny.
Your idea of humor?
I'll have time to laugh later.
Men, attack!
